comment: Good teacher and knows his stuff well. I learn well with him. His homeworks can be tedious but they are very helpful and you will understand the material well if you do them. He also provides test reviews which are extra credit for the tests if completed, albeit optional. He's a bit awkward though and struggles to really engage the class.

He is super nice and easy to ask questions or concerns about the lecture. My biggest advice is do the home works and quizzes oN TIME! I was shocked to see how the homework and quizzes were exact copies on all the test. Don't goof-open WebWorks daily to see if he uploaded the quiz. Sometimes he was inconsistent -which was annoying-but its key!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Really enjoyed all around. Would recommend if he teaches this class again
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I wish this man was my father. He has the best energy and cares so much about what he teaches and who he teaches. He's an extremely lenient grader. You will make an A for sure if you just show up, take notes, do your homework, and study. It's an easy A! Everyone loves Dhruba!
Protect this man at all costs
Overall great professor. His tests are a lot like the review guides he posts.

I had Dr. Adhikari for a summer semester Calc 3 class. He cares about his students and their success.  Consistent weekly homework assignments but it follows what you went over in class, so fairly easy to complete. Three tests and a final, final can make up 1 lowest test grade if it helps your overall grade!

Only 3 Exams and a Final, all hand written. Homework can be a bit annoying with having to get a 100 on a skill quiz before having access to the homework. Overall for a hard course he teaching style is easy to follow and understand.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Took him online. Just attend the lectures, take notes/examples, and do the homework. His tests are based on the homework questions, so do them. They are very similar in terms of structure and concepts. If you understand how to do the homework, then the tests will not be hard. I passed with a B and Math is one of the subjects I struggle with.

His lecturer are very boring. He goes deep in proof of each formulas. He is a hard grader of tests and does not curve. I took him for summer which was haptic but expected. We had like 4 chapter worth of hw due each week on mymatlab. He is very helpful in explaining concepts and during office hours. During test he gave little time to submit test.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. A is a brilliant professor who is always willing to help his students. Calc 2 is a challenging course but Dr. A is very knowledgeable and is able to explain a concept in different ways. All professors assign homework via MyMathLab, so you will have about the same quantity and difficulty of homework regardless of your choice of professor.

He can answer any questions you have clearly and wants you to understand the material and do good in his class. I had to work really hard in this class, but I came out of it with a good understanding of the subject. Would take him again for sure.

Offers a different approach to ODE. He likes graphing things out to give a different way of visualizing the problem. Incredibly patient and kind. He encourages questions, and can be easily reached outside of class. He spends time making sure everyone understands the material. His tests are based off hw and its graded for completion before each test

Professor A is a very knowledgable person and it is very evident through his lectures. The material he teaches, however, is sometimes very hard to learn for non math majors. Only grades were labs and tests which make every assignment much more important. Tests are straight from the homework assigned. Make sure to pay attention and do examples
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: The only thing bad about this professor is how hard it is to get into the classes he teaches. He loves math a lot and it shows when he teaches. His test are straight off the homework, but he does go more in depth in the lectures, which really makes him stand out. Also, his office hours were great if you're confused. Overall, a really great prof.

One of the best professors ive ever had. He gives 3 tests, and the final replaces the lowest one. Test questions come from the practice questions on webassign. Gives a lot of partial credit< he gets excited about lectures and keeps you entertained.

If you aren't a math major/passionate about the subject, I'd recommend steering clear. Goes out of his way to breakdown proofs for different equations. Is very knowledgeable, but that facet of his teaching took away from reinforcing concepts.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's really passionate about math, it shows when he lectures. I love math, so I may be biased, but he really is a good professor to take. He has office hours, so if you need help, he'll be glad to help you to further understand. There are 3 tests and a final and nothing dropped, but if you do the hw and the review, you'll get a good grade.

Just do all the homework he assigns and make sure you understand it. If you don't understand it, ask him for help. He is very caring and willing to help. He was always happy and smiling during lecture and you can tell that he really loves mathematics. He made calc4 more bearable for sure. It's a tough subject but he makes it easier.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: I took Adhikari during when he did the inquiry based approach. I would ignore any of the previous reviews since he is no longer doing it again. That being said, he is extremely nice and understanding. His tests can be hard,but definitely doable, and will work with you to better your grade. He loves mathematics, and you will see it in the lectures.

Fall 2017 semester he structured the class as inquiry-based for a nationwide research project. The main problem is that he did not seem prepared for it. The material is relatively easy but him not fully explaining it to us is what makes the class hard. Adhikari is a nice guy, I just feel like this method is not effective in a college setting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM, There is no book use in this class and all you have to go by are worksheets that he passes out form some random book that is never mentioned in the syllabus, He DOES NOT lecture and puts you in to groups to inquire how to do material without any prior knowledge, If he ever lectures, its worse than learning through inquiry in groups

Willing to answer questions in class and outside of class. Provided free link to textbook, otherwise cheap (about $30). Recommend reading the book! It's a great textbook, not terrible like Pearson or McGraw. Homework plays a large role. Many test problems come from homework. Lectures are difficult to understand. Tests are 8 questions choose 5.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Enthusiastic about his work, teaches very well and clearly, helpful, and quiz questions are fair, gives no extra credit or grade curves, but will work with you if you think your grade should be better for a specific question on tests/quizzes.  No graded homework, but you need to do the problems in the book to pass.

overall good professor.  he tends to spend more time on examples and problems than the conceptual and theory parts.  he is an easy grader and teaches using the whiteboard.  he tends to make small mistakes but nothing that confuses too much.  he does have an accent but it is easy to understand.  his linear algebra class was easy, made an A  low efrt

I personally could not understand how re-writing on the board what the book says word for word is any help. He is more of a hey we are going to read the section together and then you are going to go do homework problems (which are due weekly and take about 10 hours to do) kind of professor. Schedules sessions outside of class to go over problems...

I had Dr. Adhikari for PDE's, and I won't lie, I was not at all prepared for the level of the course. Lucky, he is a a great instructor and very helpful during lecture and office hours. While he is teaching, he is constantly scanning the room to make sure there are no puzzled faces, and if there are, he will happily take a step back.
Do the homework he assigns. His quizzes and tests come from that. He tells you that the online version of the book is okay to use and you don't have to buy the book.
Very Easy. Stays true to the homework he assigns; tests and quizzes come directly from the homework. Gave a pdf of the book so no one would have to buy it.

I took Calc II from Dr. Adhikari this semester and may not have passed if it weren't for the fact that he's such a good teacher. His tests come from the HW and he grades very fairly. I would recommend taking his class, especially if it's a more difficult math and I, myself, hope to take another class of his in the future.

He's a wonderful teacher. I took a very difficult subject and was able to pass due to Dr. Adhikari. He did not give me an easy A or anything like that, but it is very clear he cares about student success. His teaching style is excellent and his lectures are thorough, yet easy to follow.
He is a great teacher.
test are just like the HW from the book. The HW is not taken up but the problems are used in the quizzes and tests.  Easy grader as well.
Very great professor. He is knowledgeable and is incredibly helpful! If you do the homework, the quizzes(unannounced) and tests will be straight forward. I recommend taking this professor!
Great professor. Adds insight  to lectures. Tests come from homework. Do your homework and you will do well. Super nice and very helpful.

Love this teacher. He is always in his office during his office hours. If you do the homework, you will pass no problem. His quizzes are pop. His test are easy. HIGHLY recommend him as a teacher. Wish I had him for all my math classes.

He is very enthusiastic about his work and very willing to answer any questions you have. His quizzes are not too difficult, but make sure you know your stuff. Do the homework, attend lectures, and you will do fine. He takes attendance daily by passing a sign in sheet.

This professor will help you get an A in this class. I highly recommend taking him. I was able to make an A, despite the fact that I'm not very strong in math. Do the homework and understand it and an A is almost guaranteed.

Hes a good teacher but grades tough and often gives incorrect information regarding the test. For example, for the final he said thered be 8 questions and to study a certain 8 sections. One of them wasnt on the test and instead another was so thats 14 points just gone. Another time he said hed give all formulas except 2 but he didnt include others.

Diff Eq is a tough subject, but not with this guy.  He's a good teacher and his tests are a cakewalk.  He gives a practice test and that's really all you need to ace the test.  He assigns optional (but highly encouraged) homework; I have done none of it and still gotten 100 and 95 on the first two tests.  Know your algebra and especially your Cal2.
